alert.note: Alert for Gogebic; Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 5:16AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...SOME ACCUMULATING SNOW TODAY, MORE EXPECTED TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY... A band of moderate snowfall is expected to set up over the western portions of Gogebic and Ontonagon counties later today. Wet snowfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches, locally 4 inches, is expected in western Gogebic and Ontonagon counties today; less than an inch is expected over the eastern areas. Therefore, be sure to be alert and drive cautiously if traveling today in western Gogebic and Ontonagon counties as roads could be slick and visibilities could become a half mile or less at times as snowfall rates could exceed half an inch per hour, particularly during the afternoon hours. Tonight into Friday, additional snowfall is expected over the area, ranging from 4 to 8 inches along the Lake Superior shoreline with isolated amounts up to around a foot possible in the Porkies; lesser amounts are expected in the interior areas.
